task.title: Making a Character
task.shortdesc: This is the step-by-step process for making a character.

taskbody.context: Making a character may take a little while, especially including any conceptual steps to figure out what the goals in this character are. Record it all on the character sheet.

step.cmd: Concept: Come up with what the character does, who they are, what generally are they good at, what are they bad at, and what is their history, etc.

Attributes: Determine the characters attributes. Take 30 attribute points, start all attributes at 1, and distribute those attribute points among the various attributes, with each attribute point adding 1 to the attribute it is applied to. Reference: .

Skills: Determine the characters skills. Take 20 skill points, start all skills at 0, and distribute those skill points among the various skills, with each attribute adding 1 to the attribute it is applied to. Reference: .

Classes: Determine the characters classes. Take 5 class points, start all classes at 0, and distribute those class points among the classes, with each class point adding 1 to the class it is applied to. Reference: .
Derived Attributes: Based on attributes, record derived attributes. Reference: .

Goals, Habits, Facets: Determine the characters goals, habits, and facets. Think long and hard about it, and record them down. Try to come up with at least 1 of each, but more is always welcome. Reference: .
